audience.otherprops: machine operators, maintenance personnel, reliability engineers, safety and compliance officers, fleet managers

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Procedures to check tyre pressure, inflate tyres correctly and assess tyre condition for safe operation.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: ensure correct tyre pressure and inspect tyre condition for safe operation

note.p: Personal injury or death could result when tyres are inflated incorrectly.
Use a self-attaching inflation chuck and stand behind the tread when inflating a tyre.
Proper inflation equipment, and training in using the equipment, are necessary to avoid overinflation. A tyre blowout or rim failure can result from improper or misused equipment.

body.p: Always remove (deflate) all air from a single tyre and from both tyres on a dual assembly before changing them.

note.p: When changing tyres, change them in sets, even if only one of the tyres is damaged. If new and used tyres are used on the same axle, tilting of the mast and rapid tyre wear will result.
The mounting faces of the hub, wheel nuts and wheels must be free of any foreign material and lubricants of any kind. Tighten wheel nuts again after 24 hours of operation.

body.p: Do not reinflate a tyre that has been driven on while flat or underinflated, without first checking to be sure the locking ring on the wheel is not damaged and in position.
Always deflate tyres before changing them.
